tool.name: Pycoqc
tool.description: quality control for Nanopore sequencing data
tool.command: pycoQC --min_pass_qual '$min_pass_qual' --min_pass_len '$min_pass_len' #if $filter_calibration: '$filter_calibration' #end if #if $filter_duplicated: '$filter_duplicated' #end if --min_barcode_percent '$min_barcode_percent' --report_title '$report_title' ## can be implemented in future - --template_file ## can be implemented in future - --config_file #if $skip_coverage_plot '$skip_coverage_plot' #end if --sample '$sample' ## can be implemented in future --default_config --summary_file '$summary_file' ## can be implemented in future --barcode_file #if $bam_file: --bam_file '$bam_file' #end if --html_outfile '$out_html' #if $out_json: --json_outfile '$out_json' #end if

param.label: A sequencing_summary file
param.help: Must be generated by Albacore 1.0.0 + (read_fast5_basecaller.py) / Guppy 2.1.3+ (guppy_basecaller)

param.label: An alignment file generated by aligning the reads described in the sequencing_summary file
Minimum quality to consider a read as 'pass'
Minimum read length to consider a read as 'pass'
Filter Calibration?
param.help: If yes, reads flagged as calibration strand by the basecaller are removed

param.label: Filter Duplicated?
param.help: If yes, duplicated read_ids are removed but the first occurence is kept (Guppy sometimes outputs the same read multiple times)

param.label: Minimal percent of total reads to retain barcode label
param.help: If below, the barcode value is set as unclassified

param.label: Title to use in the html report
Skip the coverage plot in HTML report?
param.help: Useful when using a reference file containing many sequences, i.e. transcriptome

param.label: Number of reads will be randomly selected instead of the entire dataset for ploting function
